files.help:
Currently unsupported
BOTH an "on-startup-macro-file" and an "on-demand-module-directory"

*IF* used as a module directory using the -L option, we can do a workaround by creating an alias to set the a global default -L option:
```bash
alias jq="jq -L $XDG_DATA_HOME/jq"
```

This default can not be changed using the -L option if using an alias, consider using another name for the alias like ```jql```

_Relevant issue:_ https://github.com/jqlang/jq/issues/2966
